title: Quick question about Orianna.
body:
What does it take to play Orianna ? Or maybe if someone could like tell me what kind of playstyle should one have in order to be 'born' for Orianna.

I like bursting from a distance but surely there's more to that when playing Orianna.

I have friends that play shaco and sivir if it's just teamfighting :p

replies.body:
Back in the days where I was in love with Orianna...

If you want a guaranteed win:
- Have a hard initiator/diver on your team

If you want to have fun:
- Play her 24/7

That was my rule...I still picked according to my team, but when I see a Vi, Jarvan etc oh boy, it's time to whip out that Shockwave

I guess it's like multi tasking or managing two separate things at once.. 
you have to look after the ball and you have to look after Ori

Think of her ball as a champ of it's own: 

This champ can pull all surrounding enemies towards it while doing big damage
it can release spikes to all enemies surrounding it and give speed buffs
It moves in fast dashes and hurts what it passes through
and it can dash to an ally and shield it.. 

And Ori holds the health and mana for the ball and it's up to you to keep her safe and to use her to transport the ball around the map.

Try playing her like that for a couple games .. Imagine that the ball is really the champ.

I love Ori! By far the best champion in my books. Honestly, there are so many different ways to play her and use her in team compositions that you really should just play what suits the occasion. She's a great utility mid with a shield, slow, speed and displacement so you can play and build her for a team that needs a little bit of help surviving long fights. At full build she can clear whole minion waves with either q+w / q+e. Which makes her really good for pushing or holding turrets. She has great burst and can easily be the team carry. If you land a 3 -5 man ulti into Q you've pretty much won every team fight. I'm not a pro player or anything but I can definitely say that she is one of the most versatile champs out there :) I hope you enjoy learning how to play her!
she have a nice burst, the range of ur Q is decent and also u can control the team fight with ur Q and also able to turn the game around if u land a good R on the enemy backline
